title: 110_hr1387
content: The Act titled "Jean Lafitte National Historical Park and Preserve Boundary Adjustment Act of 2007" adjusts the boundaries of the Jean Lafitte National Historical Park and Preserve. The National Parks and Recreation Act of 1978 is amended to adjust the boundaries of the Barataria Preserve Unit in the Jean Lafitte National Historical Park and Preserve. The Secretary is authorized to acquire land for the Barataria preserve unit. The Secretary is authorized to acquire land, water, and interests within the area depicted on the map through donation, purchase, transfer from other Federal agencies, or exchange. Private land in the area can only be acquired with the owner's consent. The historical park and preserve boundary will be adjusted to reflect the acquisition of private land in the area. Federal land acquired will be transferred to the National Park Service without consideration. Easements will be granted to ensure hurricane protection for communities in the area. The map acquired or transferred shall be subject to easements agreed upon by the Secretary and the Secretary of the Army. The Secretary may acquire state land, water, and interests in land and water, as well as oil and gas rights. Subsections (b) through (f) are removed and replaced with new provisions. The Secretary is required to preserve and protect the land, water, and interests in the Barataria Preserve Unit by maintaining fresh water drainage patterns, vegetative cover, ecological and biological systems, and water and air quality. Additionally, hunting, fishing, and trapping regulations are amended to clarify management by the Secretary on designated lands. The Secretary is responsible for managing water, with amendments to the National Parks and Recreation Act of 1978 for administration. The National Parks and Recreation Act of 1978 is amended to change references from Barataria Marsh Unit to Barataria Preserve Unit and from Jean Lafitte National Historical Park to Jean Lafitte National Historical Park and Preserve.
